citeinfo.title: Summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species listings, 1976-2019

descript.abstract: These data document the summary of species, by taxonomic group, listed as threatened or endangered by the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service from 1 July 1976 to 30 September 2019 for the United States. Data were compiled from two sources: the Endangered Species Bulletins and the Environmental Conservation Online system (ECOS), http://ecos.fws.gov/tess_public/reports/box-score-report.
descript.purpose: To create a temporal data set of species listed as threatened or endangered, by taxonomic group. The data are provided because the Fish & Wildlife Service does not provide temporal counts of threatened and endangered species, only counts of single points in time.

spdom.descgeog: United States and its territories, including American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands. Nations with which the U.S. shares jurisdiction are also included.

idinfo.useconst:
These data were collected using funding from the U.S. Government and can be used without additional permissions or fees. If you use these data in a publication, presentation, or other research product please use the following citation:
Knowles, Michael S.; Flather, Curtis H. 2019. Summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species listings, 1976-2019. Fort Collins, CO: Forest Service Research Data Archive. https://doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2019-0046

tool.tooldesc: SAS is a statistical software suite developed by SAS Institute Inc., Cary, NC, USA that can be used for a variety of purposes including analysis and data management.

attracc.attraccr: Listings were manually transcribed from the box scores into a SAS software program.

dataqual.logic: Values were manually checked within the SAS software program and in the hardcopy print.
dataqual.complete: Data are complete. Missing values indicate that no species with a group (e.g., Arachnids) had been listed as threatened or endangered as of that date.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service Environmental Conservation Online System
citeinfo.title: Endangered Species Bulletin Box Score

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service Environmental Conservation Online System
citeinfo.title: Listed Species Summary (Boxscore)

procstep.srcused: Endangered Species Bulletins and ECOS Box Score
procstep.procdesc:
Data were compiled in periodic intervals for the number of species listed and recovery plans, by group, from the Endangered Species Bulletin publications and Environmental Conservation Online System (ECOS) Box Score. Groups reported were amphibians, arachnids, birds, clams, corals, crustaceans, fishes, insects, mammals, reptiles, snails, total plants, and grand totals.
Data were manually transcribed from publication or online report into a SAS software program that created the master data set.

overview.eaover:
Below you will find a complete list and description of the files available in this data publication.
NOTE: data files are available in two different file formats (CSV and XLSX)
\Data\danger.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing the summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species from 1 July 1976 through 30 September 2019, by taxonomic group. Data compiled from the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service's Endangered Species Bulletin and Environmental Conservation Online System.
\Data\danger_modified_mollusk.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing the summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species from 1 July 1976 through 30 September 2019, by taxonomic group. Four time periods (19 March 2008, 13 May 2008, 13 August 2008, and 28 November 2008) were modified due to an accounting change tied to species collectively referenced as O'ahu tree snails (Achatinella spp.). Data compiled from the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service's Endangered Species Bulletin and Environmental Conservation Online System.
\Data\variable_descriptions.csv: Comma-delimited ASCII text file containing the variable name and description for danger.csv and danger_modified_mollusk.csv.
\Data\danger.xlsx: Microsoft Excel Open XML spreadsheet file containing (a) the summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species from 1 July 1976 through 30 September, by taxonomic group, in sheet labelled "danger" and (b) the metadata defining the variables, sheet labelled "variable_descriptions". Data compiled from the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service's Endangered Species Bulletin and Environmental Conservation Online System.
\Data\danger_modified_mollusk.xlsx: Microsoft Excel Open XML spreadsheet file containing (a) the summary of U.S. threatened and endangered species from 1 July 1976 through 30 September, by taxonomic group, in sheet labelled "danger_modified_mollusk" and (b) the metadata defining the variables, sheet labelled "variable_descriptions". Four time periods (19 March 2008, 13 May 2008, 13 August 2008, and 28 November 2008) were modified due to an accounting change ties to species collectively referenced as O'ahu tree snails (Achatinella spp.). Data compiled from the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service's Endangered Species Bulletin and Environmental Conservation Online System.
Below is a list of the variables found in data files (not necessarily in this order). Each variable is the count (number) of species that are listed as threatened or endangered in the U.S. (this includes territories and nations that the U.S. shares jurisdiction with).
date = Date of report (format is: dd Mon yyyy, where dd = numeric day, Mon = 3-letter abbreviation for month, yyyy = numeric year)
end_m = Endangered listings of mammals thrt_m = Threatened listings of mammals all_m = Total threatened and endangered listings of mammals
end_b = Endangered listings of birds thrt_b = Threatened listings of birds all_b = Total threatened and endangered listings of birds
end_r = Endangered listings of reptiles thrt_r = Threatened listings of reptiles all_r = Total threatened and endangered listings of reptiles
end_am = Endangered listings of amphibians thrt_am = Threatened listings of amphibians all_am = Total threatened and endangered listings of amphibians
end_f = Endangered listings of fishes thrt_f = Threatened listings of fishes all_f = Total threatened and endangered listings of fishes
end_s = Endangered listings of snails thrt_s = Threatened listings of snails all_s = Total threatened and endangered listings of snails
end_cl = Endangered listings of clams thrt_cl = Threatened listings of clams all_cl = Total threatened and endangered listings of clams
end_mo = Endangered listings of mollusks (Snails and Clams combined) thrt_mo = Threatened listings of mollusks (Snails and Clams combined) all_mo = Total threatened and endangered listings of mollusks (Snails and Clams combined)
end_cr = Endangered listings of crustaceans thrt_cr = Threatened listings of crustaceans all_cr = Total threatened and endangered listings of crustaceans
end_i = Endangered listings of insects thrt_i = Threatened listings of insects all_i = Total threatened and endangered listings of insects
end_ar = Endangered listings of arachnids thrt_ar = Threatened listings of arachnids all_ar = Total threatened and endangered listings of arachnids
end_p = Endangered listings of plants thrt_p = Threatened listings of plants all_p = Total threatened and endangered listings of plants
end_co = Endangered listings of corals thrt_co = Threatened listings of corals all_co = Total threatened and endangered listings of corals
end_ani = Endangered listings of animals thrt_ani = Threatened listings of animals all_ani = Total threatened and endangered listings of animals
end_all = Endangered listings of all taxa thrt_all = Threatened listings of all taxa all_all = Total threatened and endangered listings of all taxa
all_ani = Total threatened and endangered listings of animals
overview.eadetcit:
Flather, Curtis H.; Brady, Stephen J.; Knowles, Michael S. 1999. Wildlife resource trends in the United States: A technical document supporting the 2000 RPA Assessment. Gen. Tech. Rep. RMRS-GTR-33. Fort Collins, CO: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Rocky Mountain Research Station. 79 p. https://doi.org/10.2737/RMRS-GTR-33
Flather, Curtis H.; Knowles, Michael S.; McNees, Jason. 2008. Geographic patterns of at-risk species: A technical document supporting the USDA Forest Service Interim Update of the 2000 RPA Assessment. Gen. Tech. Rep. RMRS-GTR-211. Fort Collins, CO: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Rocky Mountain Research Station. 21 p. https://doi.org/10.2737/RMRS-GTR-211
Flather, Curtis H.; Knowles, Michael S.; Jones, Martin F.; Schilli, Carol. 2013. Wildlife population and harvest trends in the United States: a technical document supporting the Forest Service 2010 RPA Assessment. Gen. Tech. Rep. RMRS-GTR-296. Fort Collins, CO: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Rocky Mountain Research Station. 94 p. https://doi.org/10.2737/RMRS-GTR-296
USDA Forest Service. 2016. Future of America's Forests and Rangelands: Update to the 2010 Resources Planning Act Assessment. Gen. Tech. Report WO-GTR-94. Washington, DC. 250 p. https://www.fs.usda.gov/treesearch/pubs/53212

distinfo.distliab:
Metadata documents have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness. Unless otherwise stated, all data and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. However, neither the author, the Archive, nor any part of the federal government can assure the reliability or suitability of these data for a particular purpose. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed for a user's application of these data or related materials.
The metadata, data, or related materials may be updated without notification. If a user believes errors are present in the metadata, data or related materials, please use the information in (1) Identification Information: Point of Contact, (2) Metadata Reference: Metadata Contact, or (3) Distribution Information: Distributor to notify the author or the Archive of the issues.
